event.title: named after King George III which now

data.event: The City Skyline is dominated by Fort King George, an 18th-century fortification named after King George III which now hosts a historic/archaeologic museum.
Scarborough's deepwater harbour was built in 1991; before that ships were forced to anchor offshore.

The facility has a capasity in its main hall of 5000+as well as a conference and lecture halls The City has a spanking new Library as well as new Scarborough General Hospital completed in late 2012 and late 2014 respectively there also the new Victor.E.Bruce financial complex there is also planned a New Market an Indoor Sporting Complex in Bacolet as well as a Zoo and Mega mall and a Hotel.

event.title: became the capital of Tobago in 1769

data.event: Scarborough became the capital of Tobago in 1769 when it replaced the then-capital of Georgetown.
